basics.name: Brendan Cazier
basics.label: Mechanical Engineer
basics.summary: A mechanical engineer by education, having spent all of my early career fixing physical problems in aircraft maintenance and reliability. I've often used coding as a hobby and to try to automate various tasks either at work or at home, but I'm now looking to turn that into my profession. I have worked on both long-term and large-scope campaigns, in addition to high urgency, triage-esque, projects. I enjoy problem solving, and have worked to provide solutions while being conscious of labor difficulties, costs, reliability and regulatory requirements, and more.

courses: CSCI-1190 - Beginning C Programming for Engineers

work.company: American Airlines - Tech Ops - Maintenance & Engineering
work.summary: Working in the hangars alongside mechanics to revise errors in technical documentation, providing reinforcing repairs and damage removal instructions. This damage required evaluation, repair development and approval, and documentation, typically within a few hours, to ensure work continued and the Maintenance visits did not exceed scheduled span. Kind of like installing metal bandaids on the outsides of the fuselage.
highlights: Addressing corrosion, wear, impact, and other damage with reinforcing doubler/tripler repairs.
Maintaining regulatory compliance to 14CFR43, and internal/OEM requirements.
Primarily B737-NG and A320F fleets, but also including B777 and B787 mods, as well as B737-MAX deliveries.

work.summary: Returning under a project contract to implement a pest control program, and historical maintenance tracking.
highlights: Implemented fleetwide (900+ aircraft) pest control program
Created an Excel VBA "Program" to provide B757 lessors with generated reports of Electrical Load and Structural Modification data
Tracked component environmental exposure to minimize unnecessary replacement and rework.

work.company: American Airlines - Tech Ops - Maintenance & Engineering
work.position: Coop/Internships — Narrow- and Widebody Fleet Engineering
work.summary: One of the largest airlines globally, AA Tech Ops maintains a number of different aircraft fleets from multiple manufacturers. I worked with them, on and off for three years while in school, as a coop and intern in various Fleet project groups.
highlights: Revised technical manuals to improve reliability, save on cost and labor, and incorporate regulatory/OEM requirements.
Developed Nitrogen Generation System safety program to demonstrate airline capability to the FAA
Designed a drop-in air filtration system, prototyped with vendors, and implemented across fleets, in excess of 500 aircraft
Analyzed repeat Maintenance issues to evaluate the possibility of extending the out-of-service check intervals by 50%

work.company: SWECO - MI SWACO, A Schlumberger Company
work.summary: SWECO is an American oilfield services manufacturer of industrial filtration devices for separating solids and fluids.
highlights: Replaced catalog of approximately 4000 individual hydraulic component CAD models with parametrically-generated designs and frameworks, allowing for on-the-fly creation of parts
The parametric generation approach resulted in ~75% decrease in storage requirements and 3x speed increase, while also providing the functionality of creating individually customizable models
Developed and offered a training program for combining the individual components to create full oilfield assemblies to sales departments
